description: Triangular array T read by rows: T(1,1)=1, T(2,1)=3, T(2,2)=2; for n >= 3, T(n,1)=p(n) and for k=2,3,...,n, T(n,k) = m*p(n+1-k), where m is the least positive integer such that q*p(n+1-k) is not any T(i,j) for 1<=i<=n-1 nor any T(n,j) for j<=k-1.
comments: A permutation of the natural numbers.
links: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
author: _Clark Kimberling_
